item.title: U.S. Finds Vietnam Manipulated Currency
item.description: The Treasury Department‘s determination will open the door to tariffs on tires from Vietnam and provide the first test case of a Trump administration initiative to tariff countries for alleged currency manipulation.

item.title: Chinese Diplomats Helped Military Scholars Visiting the U.S. Evade FBI Scrutiny, U.S. Says
item.description: The U.S. closed the Chinese consulate in Houston and ordered China to remove the researchers after finding what officials say was an intelligence-gathering operation aided by diplomats to collect cutting-edge scientific research from American universities.

item.title: Russia Denies Blame for Navalny Poisoning, Rebuffs Calls for Probe
item.description: The Kremlin said it had no involvement in the sudden illness of Russian dissident Alexei Navalny and questioned the assertion this week by German doctors that he was poisoned, pushing back against demands from Western leaders for an inquiry.

item.title: China's Top Diplomat Begins Europe Tour Aiming to Rekindle Cooling Ties
item.description: China’s top diplomat began a weeklong tour of Europe seeking to counter growing wariness of Beijing’s increasingly assertive foreign policy amid the coronavirus pandemic and worsening relations between Beijing and Washington.

item.title: Covid Crisis Drives Historic Drop in Global Trade
item.description: Global trade flows collapsed in the spring, marking the largest fall in two decades, as coronavirus lockdowns disrupted air and sea transport and dealt a blow to the demand for many consumer and investment goods.

item.title: Going to School in Mexico Now Means Turning on the TV
item.description: Mexico’s government is working with private broadcasters to deliver televised classes to 30 million public-school students, many of whom lack internet access.
